summary: Build an interactive, modern-technology Google Drive–like web app with a catchy name, featuring a file/folder UI and the ability to download a single folder containing all files, with the project structured for hosting in GitHub and publishing/deployment.
known_issues: Critical regression/bug: Folder creation not working in UI.
Critical regression/bug: File uploads not working.
Critical regression/bug: UI buttons not responding/working; needs verification of other core interactions.
Bug/regression: Users are not able to open files from the UI (file open/preview/download action not working).
Bug: App shows “Unable to load your drive — Connection not ready. Please wait a moment and try again.” indicating backend/agent/connection initialization not ready, blocking Drive load.
User reports the deployed app/version is still not opening (app or file-open action remains non-functional).

existing_features.title: Create a catchy English product name for the app and use it consistently across the UI (app title/header), browser title, and README.
Implement file operations end-to-end (frontend + backend): upload, download, rename, delete, and move files between folders, using an interactive UI modeled after a modern cloud-drive file manager.
Implement folder navigation and management UI: create folders, open folders, breadcrumb navigation, and folder-level rename/delete actions.
Add the ability to download a single folder that contains all files in that folder hierarchy (recursive export) as one downloadable archive produced in the browser (no server-side zip generation).

Add modern, interactive UI behaviors: sortable list/grid toggle, search within the current folder, selection (single/multi), and contextual actions (toolbar buttons and/or right-click menu) for selected items.

Provide a coherent, catchy visual theme (no default/unstyled look) and apply it consistently across screens: choose a distinct color palette (avoid blue/purple), typography, spacing, and component styling using Tailwind + existing UI components (compose, do not edit immutable UI component sources).
Add Internet Identity sign-in and associate stored files/folders with the signed-in principal so each user sees only their own drive contents.

Create repo-ready project documentation for GitHub and publishing: include a README with local development steps, building, deploying to the Internet Computer (dfx), and how to export/download a folder.
Add empty/loading/error states throughout the file manager experience (first-time empty drive, empty folder, upload failure, download failure) with clear English user-facing copy.
Render the generated static images (logo and empty-state illustration) from frontend/public/assets/generated within the UI (e.g., header logo and empty-state area).

Fix root-level navigation and ID handling so folder listing, file listing, folder creation, and file upload work when the user is in the top-level “My Drive” view (i.e., when there is no selected folder). Ensure the frontend never calls backend folder/file APIs with an invalid placeholder folderId such as an empty string.

Fix the upload dialog and related button behavior so “Upload Files” reliably opens/closes and upload completion correctly updates UI state and success messaging. Ensure the dialog’s open/close handler respects the boolean argument from the Dialog component and does not prevent closing unintentionally.

Audit and fix any authorization/initialization issues that prevent mutations (create folder, upload file, rename/delete/move) from executing after Internet Identity login, including cases where access-control initialization depends on a missing/empty admin secret. Ensure user-facing errors are shown in English and the UI does not appear “dead” when a backend call traps.

Run a focused smoke-test of core Drive interactions and fix any additional regressions discovered that make the UI feel non-functional (e.g., open folder, breadcrumb navigation, selection toolbar actions) without expanding scope beyond reliability/bug fixes.

Make the Drive browsing experience reliably show the signed-in user’s folders and files: after Internet Identity login (and profile setup if required), the app must load and render the user’s root (“My Drive”) contents and allow opening a folder to view its files.

Enable opening a file from the file list/grid by clicking the file row/card (or file name), with a clear default behavior: open the file in a new browser tab when possible, and otherwise download it. Ensure this works in both list view (ItemList) and grid view (ItemGrid) without interfering with selection checkboxes or the action menus.

Add an explicit "Open" action for files in both the file actions dropdown (FileActions) and the right-click context menu (ItemContextMenu), and keep the existing "Download" action. "Open" must reuse the same underlying open/download logic as clicking the file in the list/grid.

Prevent the app from showing the destructive Drive error state (“Unable to load your drive”) for transient Internet Computer connection/actor initialization states; instead, keep the user in a clear loading/connecting state until the backend actor is ready or a real initialization error is confirmed.

Make actor initialization resilient: if access-control initialization (the call to `_initializeAccessControlWithSecret`) fails due to a missing/empty secret or other recoverable conditions, do not leave the app in a permanently broken state; surface a clear English error with an actionable retry and allow the user to continue using the app when safe to do so.

Improve Drive data-query guarding so that drive/profile queries never intentionally throw the generic frontend error `Actor not available` during normal startup; queries should be disabled or deferred until the actor is ready, avoiding the normalized message “Connection not ready. Please wait a moment and try again” being shown as a hard failure during initial load.
Update the shared file open/download utility to be robust across browsers and IC blob URLs, avoiding silent failures and ensuring correct file types are used when creating Blob/Object URLs.

Add a focused smoke test pass for "Open" behavior to prevent regressions: verify open-from-click and open-from-menu works after Internet Identity login, including at least one viewable type (e.g., image/pdf/text) and one non-viewable type (forces download).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create an interactive Google Drive clone web app using modern technologies with a catchy, modern-looking UI
Implement file/folder navigation structure (files organized into folders) in the UI
Add ability to download a single folder that contains all files (bundle/export)
Provide project structure suitable for GitHub (repo-ready) and instructions to download and publish/deploy the app
Come up with a catchy project/app name for the Google Drive clone

Implement core file/folder data model and persistence in the Motoko single-actor backend to support a Drive-like hierarchy: folders, files, and their relationships (parent folder), including metadata (name, type, size, createdAt, updatedAt).
Allow users to open a folder and see/list the files they have (file listing/browsing in the UI)

Make opening a file from the Drive UI reliably work when clicking a file row/card/name and when choosing the explicit "Open" action from menus, so that users can actually open or download the file instead of nothing happening.

projectName: Build an interactive Google Drive–like file manager with folder download export and modern UI
